It should only return null if the exception is null, otherwise the list if never empty... However, we should handle the recursive cause structures as well. I'll fix it and add a test.
I think @stuartwdouglas should look at this and the following methods and tell us if this is normal, or a bug.
The templates are built at deployment time, the error page handler runs at runtime, which means we are in a different CL to the one that built the template.
This is obviously useful, but I wonder if we should not put something more declarative in place, like ExceptionMapper<T> which JAX-RS has?
I think that this could cause class loading issues...
